issue.title: X3D Parser removed by "3MF: Migration"

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Global flag to mark a deviation from expected behaviour

labels.name: X3D
labels.description: Bugs related to the X3D format.

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
I've wanted to check one issue with X3D import (experienced on Assimp 5.0) in development branch, but instead just realized the whole X3D parser being removed by "3MF: Migration" commit of @kimkulling a half a year ago : 7e93ae4428c522dabc0778f68fd7705e034344b8

I guess there was some attempt to rewrite XML parsers in the project, but for some reason rewriting X3D parser was just stopped at removal step (I've tried to convert some X3D files in hope that I just don't understand how reader works now, but result was just a blank output file without any error message).

The commit is not associated with any pull request, where one could find some discussion about plans, so I was unable to find any details on this topic. If this is "under control", it would be nice putting some TODO message in code and report an error message on attempt to use this import plugin...

issue.title: X3D importer does not work at all; implementation appears to have been removed (Regression). Should not be exposed as an available importer.

labels.name: X3D
labels.description: Bugs related to the X3D format.

labels.name: Regression
labels.description: Bugs related to any kind of regression tests

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
Library version: master @ cd42b99
Platform: Windows 10 64-bit
Compiler: MSVC 2019 64-bit

The X3D importer fails to import all files. Furthermore, it never reports any errors. On closer inspection, the whole importer appears to be mostly unimplemented placeholder code ([source](https://github.com/assimp/assimp/blob/21d7085be6b7a3c6912ce33d9931688dc1a4a6dc/code/AssetLib/X3D/X3DImporter.cpp)). 

This appears to be a regression. As far as I can tell, the X3D importer works fine in the 5.0.1 release on the releases page.

In any case, if it's no longer implemented for some reason, it shouldn't be returned in the enumeration of available importers. Also, if it *is* going to be included, it should probably return a failure status and an error message.

This also explains why `ReadFile` doesn't fail in #3786.

Suggested fix: Do not register the X3D importer until it is reimplemented.

issue.title: X3D exporter writes malformed files (duplicate DEF names) when mesh name is empty

labels.name: X3D
labels.description: Bugs related to the X3D format.

labels.name: Export
labels.description: Bugs / Feature requests related to export.

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
Library version: master @ cd42b99
Platform: Windows 10 64-bit
Compiler: MSVC 2019 64-bit

The X3D spec defines the scope of a USE/DEF node name as the entire subtree of the node that the DEF appeared in, and requires names to be unique in that scope ([ref](https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.2/Part01/concepts.html#DEFL_USESemantics)). Meaning: If a node is named with DEF, none of its children (recursively) may have the same name, i.e. a node can't have the same name as any of its ancestors.

The X3D exporter appears to use aiMesh::mName as a prefix for the node name in Shape nodes. 

When the mesh name is empty, it produces Shape nodes such as:

```
<Shape DEF='_IDX_0'>
    <Appearance DEF='_IDX_0'>
        ...
    </Appearance>
    ...
</Shape>
```

There, the Appearance node name "_IDX_0" conflicts with the Shape node name, which is forbidden.

The X3D exporter needs to use a different strategy to ensure uniqueness of node names. It should probably also be reviewed for other instances of this same issue. I only tested with very minimal scene data.

For reference, btw, X3D files can be validated at https://savage.nps.edu/X3dValidator/.

issue.title: ReadFile fails to return error when importing unsupported files; also appears to fall back to X3D

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Global flag to mark a deviation from expected behaviour

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
Library version: master @ cd42b99
Platform: Windows 10 64-bit
Compiler: MSVC 2019 64-bit

When attempting to import a file with an unsupported extension, `Assimp::Importer::ReadFile` succeeds, runs the postprocessor, and returns an empty scene instead of failing. Additionally, the "importerIndex" property shows the index of the X3D importer. I did not attempt to verify if any code in the X3D importer was actually being used.

The expected behavior is for ReadFile to return null, with GetErrorString returning an appropriate error message.

This appears to be a regression. In the 5.0.1 Bugfix release on the releases page, attempting to load unsupported file types indeed caused ReadFile to fail, leaving "importerIndex" unset and GetErrorString returning something like "no importer found for file type" (or something like that).

[This test program](https://github.com/JC3/ModelSplit/tree/assimp-master-cd42b99/specific_tests/x3d_importer_fallback) (Qt not actually needed) demonstrates the issue. For each extension specified, it prints info about library support, and also creates a zero-length dummy file with that extension, attempts to import it, and prints info about the result. The output I'm seeing for extensions "3ds", "assjson" (which has an exporter but no importer), and "qwerty", is:

```
assimp 5.0.1 (master @ cd42b995)

Extension: "3ds"
  IsExtensionSupported:       true
  GetImporterIndex:           3
  GetImporter:                plugin=0x0000012F5897DDC0
  ->GetExtensionList:         3ds prj
  ->GetInfo->mName:           Discreet 3DS Importer
  ->GetInfo->mFileExtensions: 3ds prj
[created zero-length dummy file: dummy.3ds]
  ReadFile (pFlags=0):
    ReadFile:                 error: StreamReader: File is empty or EOF is already reached
    importerIndex:            3
    mName:                    Discreet 3DS Importer
[deleting dummy file]
---------------------------------------------------------------
Extension: "assjson"
  IsExtensionSupported:       false
  GetImporterIndex:           -1
  GetImporter:                plugin=0x0000000000000000
[created zero-length dummy file: dummy.assjson]
  ReadFile (pFlags=0):
    ReadFile:                 success
    importerIndex:            46
    mName:                    Extensible 3D(X3D) Importer
    scene->mFlags:            0x00000000
[deleting dummy file]
---------------------------------------------------------------
Extension: "qwerty"
  IsExtensionSupported:       false
  GetImporterIndex:           -1
  GetImporter:                plugin=0x0000000000000000
[created zero-length dummy file: dummy.qwerty]
  ReadFile (pFlags=0):
    ReadFile:                 success
    importerIndex:            46
    mName:                    Extensible 3D(X3D) Importer
    scene->mFlags:            0x00000000
[deleting dummy file]
---------------------------------------------------------------
```

In all cases, querying for extension support produced correct results, but ReadFile incorrectly succeeded on the unrecognized file types.

Note also that no scene flags are set in the returned scenes. Of course no scenes should be returned, but since they are, I would expect to at least see AI_SCENE_FLAGS_INCOMPLETE.

issue.title: Remove X3D importer from registry.

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
The importer does not exist right now, and should not appear in application GUIs / should not induce users to file bug reports to application developers until it is reimplemented.

#3647 (primary), #3786 (incidental)

issue.title: ASSIMP_ENABLE_DEV_IMPORTERS env var, applied to X3D importer

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
This is an alternate proposal for #3825 intended as a compromise until the X3D importer is reimplemented (it can also be applied to other importers in similar situations). It is meant to address #3647 (and, incidentally, #3786).

This allows developers to set the local ASSIMP_ENABLE_DEV_IMPORTERS environment variable to enable registration of importers that are otherwise unsuitable for release. Note that this is *not* intended to be used for importers that have bugs, etc., it's meant to be used for importers that are completely unavailable; e.g. the unimplemented X3D importer.

- GetImporterInstanceList reads ASSIMP_ENABLE_DEV_IMPORTERS env var. Development importers are enabled if the env var is set and is not equal to the literal string "0".
- X3D importer will not be registered unless ASSIMP_ENABLE_DEV_IMPORTERS is set.

Notes:

- If this change is incorporated, it should be documented.
- Effective git branch structure is a *much* better solution. This is just a possible compromise that doesn't add a lot of work.
- I think this is a hack.

It's OK to reject this PR, no feelings will be hurt. It's just another idea.

---

Quick example; shows that X3D support is only enabled when env var is set:

```
c:\Users\jason\Packages\assimp-git\BINARIES\x64\bin\Release>assimp listext
*.3d;*.3ds;*.3mf;*.ac;*.ac3d;*.acc;*.amf;*.ase;*.ask;*.assbin;*.b3d;*.blend;*.bvh;*.cob;*.csm;*.dae;*.dxf;*.enff;*.fbx;*.glb;*.gltf;*.hmp;*.ifc;*.ifczip;*.irr;*.irrmesh;*.lwo;*.lws;*.lxo;*.m3d;*.md2;*.md3;*.md5anim;*.md5camera;*.md5mesh;*.mdc;*.mdl;*.mesh;*.mesh.xml;*.mot;*.ms3d;*.ndo;*.nff;*.obj;*.off;*.ogex;*.pk3;*.ply;*.pmx;*.prj;*.q3o;*.q3s;*.raw;*.scn;*.sib;*.smd;*.stl;*.stp;*.ter;*.uc;*.vta;*.x;*.xgl;*.xml;*.zae;*.zgl

c:\Users\jason\Packages\assimp-git\BINARIES\x64\bin\Release>set ASSIMP_ENABLE_DEV_IMPORTERS=1

c:\Users\jason\Packages\assimp-git\BINARIES\x64\bin\Release>assimp listext
*.3d;*.3ds;*.3mf;*.ac;*.ac3d;*.acc;*.amf;*.ase;*.ask;*.assbin;*.b3d;*.blend;*.bvh;*.cob;*.csm;*.dae;*.dxf;*.enff;*.fbx;*.glb;*.gltf;*.hmp;*.ifc;*.ifczip;*.irr;*.irrmesh;*.lwo;*.lws;*.lxo;*.m3d;*.md2;*.md3;*.md5anim;*.md5camera;*.md5mesh;*.mdc;*.mdl;*.mesh;*.mesh.xml;*.mot;*.ms3d;*.ndo;*.nff;*.obj;*.off;*.ogex;*.pk3;*.ply;*.pmx;*.prj;*.q3o;*.q3s;*.raw;*.scn;*.sib;*.smd;*.stl;*.stp;*.ter;*.uc;*.vta;*.x;*.x3d;*.x3db;*.xgl;*.xml;*.zae;*.zgl

c:\Users\jason\Packages\assimp-git\BINARIES\x64\bin\Release>set ASSIMP_ENABLE_DEV_IMPORTERS=0

c:\Users\jason\Packages\assimp-git\BINARIES\x64\bin\Release>assimp listext
*.3d;*.3ds;*.3mf;*.ac;*.ac3d;*.acc;*.amf;*.ase;*.ask;*.assbin;*.b3d;*.blend;*.bvh;*.cob;*.csm;*.dae;*.dxf;*.enff;*.fbx;*.glb;*.gltf;*.hmp;*.ifc;*.ifczip;*.irr;*.irrmesh;*.lwo;*.lws;*.lxo;*.m3d;*.md2;*.md3;*.md5anim;*.md5camera;*.md5mesh;*.mdc;*.mdl;*.mesh;*.mesh.xml;*.mot;*.ms3d;*.ndo;*.nff;*.obj;*.off;*.ogex;*.pk3;*.ply;*.pmx;*.prj;*.q3o;*.q3s;*.raw;*.scn;*.sib;*.smd;*.stl;*.stp;*.ter;*.uc;*.vta;*.x;*.xgl;*.xml;*.zae;*.zgl
```

body:
I migrated the source code from version 5.0.1 to support pugixml. Sinc I did not want to get into conflict with your PR @kimkulling, I made my own PR: https://github.com/assimp/assimp/pull/4079.
One thing I noticed with one of my test files: while it took me 2,3s to load up a x3d file on version 5.0.1 it took me 17,8s to load that file after the migration (both tested Windows 10, VS2019, debug build).
